Posts.Content: When I was initially diagnosed in June 2011, my PSA was 25.3 and a Gleason of 9. I had Brachy in Nov. 2011 followed by EBRT. My PSA went to zero until Aug. 2013 when it went up to .2. three months later it was .4 and three months after that it was 1.2. At that point, my doctor said I had biochemical recurrence. So I started taking Lupron again in Feb of this year and my PSA is once again at zero. A bone scan in Feb showed two small bone mets, so I'm definitely having a recurrence. So far the Lupron is keeping my PSA at zero.
Posts.Signature: 6/28/2011 - PSA 25.3 7/15/2011 - Diagnosed Prostate Cancer, Gleason 9, Begin Lupron 10/11/2011 - PSA 1.3 11/15/2011 - Brachytherapy seed implant 12/27/2011 - .1 1/15/2012 - EBRT 3/27/2012 - PSA 0 6/28/2012 - PSA 0 12/31/2012 - PSA 0 8/13/2013 - PSA .2 11/12/2013 - PSA .4 2/11/2014 - PSA 1.2 2/27/2014 - 3 month Lupron 4/2/2014 - Bone scan shows 2 small mets on femur and skull, CT clear 4/8/2014 - PSA .04 5/12/2014 - PSA 0 5/13/2014 - Retroperitoneal Ultrasound - Clear
Posts.Title: Forum users PSA results post Bracchy?

Posts.Content: When I was initially diagnosed in June 2011, my PSA was 25.3 and a Gleason of 9. I had Brachy in Nov. 2011 followed by EBRT. My PSA went to zero until Aug. 2013 when it went up to .2. three months later it was .4 and three months after that it was 1.2. At that point, my doctor said I had biochemical recurrence. So I started taking Lupron again in Feb of this year and my PSA is once again at zero. A bone scan in Feb showed two small bone mets, so I'm definitely having a recurrence. So far the Lupron is keeping my PSA at zero.
